entry.value: Table containing information about identified proteins, most importantly full protein sequence
Table containing intensities of detected peptides

Metanode for the absolute quantification of identified proteins.%%00010%%00010Absolute quantification is calculated using the algorithm presented by He et al., 2020 (DOI: 10.1016/j.jprot.2019.03.005). The bottom input table contains information about peptide intensities in wide format. The top table is already grouped on protein level and contains full protein sequences from which the number of observable peptides is then calculated. In order to calculate the number of observable peptides, user needs to input the digestion pattern of the protease which was used during sample preparation. By default, the pattern of trypsin is used.%%00010%%00010Absolute quantities are returned as ppm and can only be calculated for proteins containing at least one unique precursor.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Please inspect your local installation and contact us if you can not locate your local version and or license terms.%%00010%%00010KNIME nodes (The KNIME nodes consists of the following GNU GPL 3.0 License. Component does not have input data, execute upstream nodes first
